oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Cycles of Even Lengths Modulo k
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: DIWAN, AA
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: graphs
cycle lengths
minimum degree
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Thomassen [J Graph Theory 7 (1983), 261-271] conjectured that for all positive integers k and m, every graph of minimum degree at least k + 1 contains a cycle of length congruent to 2m modulo k. We prove that this is true for k >= 2 if the minimum degree is at least 2k - 1, which improves the previously known bound of 3k - 2. We also show that Thomassen's conjecture is true for m = 2. (C) 2010 . J Graph Theory 65: 246-252, 2010
